snippet: The crowd yelled, ''Four more years! Four more years!'' and their cheers brought a huge smile to President Clinton.     But pleased as he might have been by his reception here and in nearby Oakland today, Mr. Clinton carefully avoided a repeat of ...
lead_paragraph: The crowd yelled, ''Four more years! Four more years!'' and their cheers brought a huge smile to President Clinton. But pleased as he might have been by his reception here and in nearby Oakland today, Mr. Clinton carefully avoided a repeat of his declaration on Thursday that Vice President Al Gore would be the ''next best thing'' to a third term. Instead, he roared through Northern California, making a more spirited argument for his vice president than Mr. Gore sometimes makes for himself.
abstract: Pres Clinton campaigns for Vice Pres Al Gore in Northern California, carefully avoiding repeat of his declaration last week that Gore would be 'next best thing' to third Clinton term; Gore campaign officials deny that Clinton's remark angered them; photo (M)

headline.main: After 'Next Best' Thing, Clinton Carefully Praises Gore
